schema.name: Healthyfied Tinola Manok

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the thigh fillets under cold water and pat dry with a paper towel.
Peel and slice the red onion. Peel and julienne the ginger root. Peel and mince the garlic.
Season the thigh fillets with salt and ground pepper evenly on both sides.
In a large pot, sauté the sliced onion, julienned ginger, and minced garlic until they are soft and aromatic, about 5 minutes.
Add the seasoned thigh fillets to the pot and sear each side for about 3 minutes, allowing them to brown slightly.
Fill the pot with enough water to cover the chicken, then bring to a boil. Lower the heat and let it simmer until the chicken is fully cooked, about 30 minutes.
Optional: Add your choice of leafy greens or papaya slices 10 minutes before finishing the cooking to incorporate more nutrients.

schema.description: Dive into a healthier version of a classic Filipino comfort food with this Healthyfied Tinola Manok. Brimming with high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar ingredients, it's a guilt-free delight for those seeking healthy yet hearty meals. Perfect for anyone looking to enjoy traditional flavors without compromising their dietary goals.
